dialogues.text: Charlie runs from the woods and reappears a moment later, dragging Louise into the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You’re not gonna believe it, Mom...it’s...it’s a miracle! Louise looks around the clearing, then at Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: (distraught ) Let’s go back now, sweetheart... Everybody's waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: But—

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: Please, Charlie. And Charlie understands that his mother can’t see Sam.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (gently) It’s okay, mom. I’m...okay now...I just want to be by myself for a while.

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE
dialogues.text: Don’t be too long... And Louise leaves. Charlie turns back to Sam, who seems a to cry.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What’s gonna happen to me, Charlie? We’re never gonna sail around the world together...or see another Red Sox game...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don’t even know where I’m supposed to go...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (fervent) Then stay right here.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Here. .?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We'll meet up every day. Sam dares to smile.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. .? The sun is setting. They hear the blast from the yacht cl cannon. Charlie gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You hear that? I’1l meet you right here. Everyday at sunset.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (grateful) Everyday? You promise?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (absolute conviction) I won’t leave you alone, Sam. I promise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a gravestone:

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL ST. CLOUD
dialogues.text: June 15, 1983 - June 9 , 1995 A cone of high-pressure water blasts leaves and bird droppings from the stone. Widen to reveal Charlie wieldin the power washer. Charlie’s pushing thirty now. He’s still boyishly handsom but in his eyes you can tell that he’s no longer young. H wears a uniform of some sort - a pale blue shirt, pressed khakis and work boots.  23. In the b.g. WE SEE cemetery workers doing various chores, washing monuments, clearing away branches, trimming hedge etc. Charlie nods with satisfaction as his chore nears complet Sam’s gravestone is sparkling...Then...he hears something...He looks up to see a flock of noisy geese pas overheard. Charlie watches them. Then he glances back at brother’s grave and smiles mysteriously. He finishes off work, gathers up the equipment and starts away. Then he notices somebody...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: An elderly woman kneeling beside a monument, which sits a a fresh mound of dirt. She is lost in thought. Charlie approaches her gently.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Phipps...? She looks up, startled. The old woman is frail and wan...nearly transparent...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiles ) It’s me. Charlie St. Cloud. Tenth grade English, remember? She looks him over. Then...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: Shame on you, Mr. St. Cloud...It is I.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, right... (smiles ) Me stand corrected. She smiles faintly. Then returns to gazing at the gravest

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I just wanted to offer my sympathies. She looks up at Charlie, filled with sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: It was just so sudden. So unexpected. I never even had time to say goodbye.  24.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: I suppose there’s never enough time, is there? Charlie shakes his head, smiles sadly. Then Mrs. Phipps stands up, she’s frightened and unsteady.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: What’s going to happen to me now? What will I do?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (comforting) It’s going to be all right. Trust me, I know... And she smiles. Charlie has reassured her. And now we see the gravestone that Charlie and Mrs. Phipp are looking at. The inscription reads:

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA PHIPPS
dialogues.text: Beloved Wife, Mother, Grandmother And Teacher.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, TRIMMING THE HEDGES
dialogues.text: Joe’s an African American dude, who works for Charlie. Jo sees Charlie but not Mrs. Phipps. Looks to him like Charl talking to himself. Again...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE AND MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: Something wonderful occurs to Mrs. Phipps, and she nods toward the gravestone right beside her own.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: Walter...my sweet Walter...I wonder if he..?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles ) Sure, he’s waiting. Good thing you’re wearing that pretty blue dress. Mrs. Phipps smiles, no longer afraid.  25.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. PHIPPS
dialogues.text: I guess there’s really no point in lingering, is there? With a final smile for Charlie she walks toward the fores with slow but purposeful steps...Charlie waves goodbye. A then she is gone. Charlie turns around to see Joe standin there...

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Know how a man in the desert, who’s gone without food and water...how he starts imagining shit..? Charlie, knows what’s coming. He starts walking down the with Joe on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, you’ve gone too long without booty, bro. That’s why you’re talking to yourself... Charlie wants to change the subject.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How about running into town for me, picking up those sprinkler heads.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Tell you what...right after work, I’‘1l go into town with you. We’1l pick up the sprinkler heads and grab a beer over at Maddie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie just looks at him. Then...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Let’s see how it goes. Joe shakes his head, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: There it is again...”“Let’s see how it goes..” Charlie starts walking away. Joe talks after him..

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Same shit, different day...  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day’s work is through. Joe and the crew are saying th goodbyes, about to get into their various vehicles. But J lingering, waiting around. A WORKER says to him:

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: (smirking) He ain’t gonna show. He likes it here... The other workers smirk and chuckle in agreement. Joe giv it up and gets into his car.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE ON A HILL, WATCHING
dialogues.text: Shadows arc across the hill dotted with ancient graves. Charlie watches until the last crew guy has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie closes the creaky cemetery gates. He locks them w a huge skeleton key. He turns to face the now deserted cemetery. He takes in its solitude and...he smiles. He ch his watch. It’s 7:10. He hurries toward- EXT. CARETAKER’S COTTAGE —- EVENING A small place with a sign out front that says, PRIVATE. CARETAKER’S COTTAGE. Beyond the cottage, on the water, we can see the hull of old, neglected sailboat - the one Charlie and Sam sailed ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is simply furnished, there are loads of books o every subject, and up on the walls...a jumble of maps and weather charts...also pictures and sketches of sailboats, sailboats and more sailboats... Charlie’s changed into jeans and a sweatshirt. He’s throw things into a bag - a toy of some sort and a baseball glo He starts for the door but before heading out, he stops t check out one of the weather charts stuck on the wall. He focusing on the daily sunset times as he tracks down with finger. There it is. Thursday the 28th. Sunset, 7:26 P.M. Charlie looks at his watch and starts for the door.  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bag in hand, Charlie takes off running towards the woods, weaving between the headstones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie races into the dark, deserted glade. He stops and smiles at the sight before him...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Thought you might be here... He sees...

dialogues.speaker: THE GAGGLE OF GEESE
dialogues.text: Frolicking on the lake that runs through the woods. Charlie reaches into the bag and removes a toy remote con boat. He’s only barely aware of the sound of the yacht cl cannon that’s fired off at sunset. Then-

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (excited) You brought it! And there stands-

dialogues.speaker: SAM ST. CLOUD
dialogues.text: Sam is unchanged after all these years. He’s still only twelve-years-old - same hair, same freckles, same Red Sox cap...same everything. Charlie lights up at the sight of just as he has every evening for the past thirteen years.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What do you say, chucklehead..?

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: The geese are frolicking on the pond...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Geese at two o’clock. Request permission to attack.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Permission granted... Now WE SEE Charlie and Sam, sitting on the edge of the la Charlie’s got a remote control in his lap. They smile at other as Charlie jams the joystick...  28. On the lake, the remote control boat begins making its wa slowly, stealthily toward the unwitting geese. Charlie and Sam watch the boat...Sam laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Did they really take a crap on Parson Reilly's head?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Oh yeah. It was like he had a bulls-— eye painted on it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (cracks up) Gross.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (watching the geese) Ssshh...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: One hundred feet and closing...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I saw Mrs. Phipps today...She was still hanging around her grave...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Did she really die getting her teeth cleaned?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (laughs) It was only a matter of time before Dr. Vogel killed someone with his stinky breath...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: She was old. She had a heart attack...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (laughs) A likely story. Vogel’s breath has actually stopped charging rhinos. (watching boat) Fifty feet and closing.  29.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Anyway...she didn’t hang around. I guess she missed her husband.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (laughs) Old man Phipps? The guy with no big toe?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sam—

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Remember how that stub was always sticking out of his sandals? How gross was that...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Well...wherever he is now...I’m sure he’s got all his toes.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (excited) -08 knots. Target acquired... The boat has reached geese vicinity. The birds regard it mild curiosity...Then...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Fire! Charlie presses some buttons on the remote control box. On the boat - the horn blares and lights flash. The geese are totally freaked. They take off, flying for their lives. Charlie and Sam are laughing heartily. High fiving each other...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Adios amigos. One big goose - obviously a pissed off alpha male, is hea back toward Charlie and Sam, honking at them.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He isn’t happy, Sam. That’s not a happy honk. Now the goose comes swooping toward them. Charlie and Sam laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here... And they race off laughing all the way.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: It’s twilight now, the stars are coming out. Charlie and are stripped down to shorts. Charlie’s standing up on a t homemade swing that’s right over the lake. Sam’s standing there laughing.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Look out, he’s actually standing up. Don’t try this at home kids...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yee-ha! And he leaps off the swing and goes into the lake. When h emerges, Sam laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Wow...and the judges are going insane...Charlie St. Cloud’s score is a whopping...minus 10! Charlie laughs from the water.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Let’s see you do better, wiseass.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Coming right up... Sam’s on the swing now, swinging and swinging...higher th is humanly possible.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Here comes Sam St. Cloud’s world famous, supersonic, quadruple flying summersault... Charlie just watches from the water as Sam goes flying of the swing.  31. Sam seems suspended in air before doing a supernatural fl spinning about five times in the air. Charlie just watches filled with awe and wonder and joy..

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE GLADE LATER
dialogues.text: Charlie and Sam stand in a dim circle of light in the cen of the clearing. They throw the ball back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (grim) I gotta go into town tomorrow. Pick up some stuff...I can already hear Mr. Cavannaugh...”Well, if it isn’t ‘The Phantom of Waterside Cemetery.'”

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Dick...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And I always manage to run into Fraffie Chapman leading one of her tour groups...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (laughs) The head of the hysterical society?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (mocking female voice) “Waterside Cemetery is a historical landmark, Mr. St. Cloud, and overgrown hedges will not be tolerated...”

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (laughs) Blow it out your butt, Fraffie...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles sadly) I wish I could just stay here, Sam. All the time. Just hanging out with you...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (smiles ) Yeah, I know... (then) I could go with you...  32.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles, shakes his head) You always end up making me laugh. They all think I’m weird enough already... Sam smiles, then...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It’s getting dark.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Go out for a long one.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Give it all you got, okay? Sam starts running out. Charlie rears back throws a high arcing fly ball.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (like an announcer) It’s a long hard drive. It could be outta here...Sam St. Cloud is on his horse... Sam's racing back, the ball’s heading over his head.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He’s at the wall now, but that ball is going...going... Sam leaps impossibly high into the air. He snags the ball with a one handed catch. And then...he smiles at Charlie disappears...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Night, Sam... Charlie smiles and waves. INT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - NIGHT Charlie is curled in an armchair with a sailing magazine. CLOSE ON MAGAZINE PHOTO: A color photograph of a beautifu serious-looking young woman, standing on a dry dock besid magnificent sailboat suspended from a cradle. The headlin reads: “Tess Carroll’s Radical New Design”.  33. Charlie stands and walks to the table which is littered w the remnants of a meal for one and hand-drawn, sailboat design sketches . He compares his designs with the boat i the magazine. The sudden, discordant, ringing of the telephone, breaks concentration. The machine kicks in. The outgoing message generic.

dialogues.speaker: MACHINE MESSAGE
dialogues.text: Please leave a message. Beep!

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi, Charlie, it’s mom. I’m just calling to...see how you are. Charlie just looks at the phone. He can hear the pain in mother’s voice. He knows he should pick it up...

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Its been so long since we’ve seen each other and Portland’s so nice this time of year...I was hoping you might come up. Charlie closes his eyes and rubs his hand across his face

dialogues.speaker: LOUISE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anyway...Call me soon. Please, Charlie. I love you. Bye. The line goes dead. A long moment. Then slowly his eyes d down to the magazine on the table...the picture of Tess Carroll and that incredible boat...Charlie sighs deeply a off the boat’s picture we...

dialogues.speaker: A SPARKLING WHITE MAINSAIL
dialogues.text: Is being hoisted up the mast of Tess Carroll’s magnificen “Querencia.” It’s emblazoned with the words: CARROLL SAIL EXT. MARBLEHEAD DOCK —- MORNING As the mainsail goes up, the small gathering applauds. TE CARROLL, prettier than her magazine picture is emotional she watches. Her mother, GRACE, who’s got a yellow lab ca Bobo on a leash, and TINK WEATHERBEE, a big bull of a man stand at her side.  34.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: The girls worked day and night on her. Best we ever built... We see now that the boat is docked in front of CARROLL SA a shop on the wharf. Now Tess addresses the sail shop sta

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I’m gonna win this race or not but I can tell you this for sure...that mainsail...it’s going to be seen by sailors on five continents...and it is glorious. Thank you. You did my father proud... The staff applaud Tess, wish her luck, etc. Her emotional says:

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Your father would be proud...And damned jealous too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess smiles. Her mother kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Have you seen your Aunt Abby yet?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: No, mom but-

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: She hasn’t got long, so you get your tail over there.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I promise I’1l see her before I take off. And as Grace goes off with the dog, A WOMAN approaches Te with her TEN-YEAR-OLD DAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss Carroll? Could she have your autograph? The smiling girl hands Tess an autograph book to sign.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I‘d be honored.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: My name is Katie.  35.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: You’re such a great role model for a girl her age... Tess hands the autograph book back to Katie.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’ll probably get pretty lonely out there, Katie...Maybe you’d like to email me. The girl looks at Tess with pity...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You don’t have a boyfriend, do you? The girl’s mom smiles, embarrassed. Tess chuckles. Tink approaches..

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Tess, that reporter is here... We see a t.v. crew walking toward the boat. Tess makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: It’s good for business...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Okay, but you’re buying me a beer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place sells everything from stationary to floor wax. As Charlie walks in, MARGIE, the cashier, lights up at th sight of him. She’s pretty, Charlie’s age.

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: Well, look who it is...What’s shaking, stranger? Charlie’s self-conscious, uncomfortable. He casts his eye downward.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Margie...

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s see ‘em...  She lifts his chin, forcing him to make eye-contact. laughs and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: Blue as they ever were. (then she calls out) Pop, Charlie St. Cloud’s here. (then) So how are you, Charlie? How have you been? Charlie smiles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Everything’s great. 36. Margie Margie just looks at him like...”Yeah, right..” Charlie avoids her eyes. Glances over at the bank of t.v.’s that playing on the wall. He’s surprised to see who it is...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess Carroll... ON THE TV’S - AN INTERVIEWER WITH TESS CARROLL Tess stands on the dock before her beautiful 38 foot boat being interviewed.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: Fewer people have sailed solo around the world than have climbed Mt. Everest, and of those who have...only eight have been women.

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: I guess I’1ll have to make it nine... Margie’s father, FRANK walks over carrying a box.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (half smiling) Well, if it isn’t the Phantom of Waterside Cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: MARGIE
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Mr. Cavannaugh...  37.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: These heads came in three days ago. I left you a message... Margie starts ringing Charlie up.

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: I come from a long line of sailors, and I’m sailing this race for all of them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Her dad owned the sail shop...Great guy. Charlie’s still watching the t.v preoccupied.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Jim Carroll...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You knew him?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I buried him. Margie and her father exchange looks. EXT. CHARLIE’S PICKUP TRUCK - DAY Charlie tosses the box inside. He’s about to get in and d off...but instead...he drifts to the corner and looks dow toward the dock. There he sees... TESS’S BOAT - THE QUERENCIA People are still milling around as Tess’s interview wraps Charlie stands there transfixed by its sheer beauty. Then, rounding the corner he sees:

dialogues.speaker: A TOUR GROUP
dialogues.text: Led by Marblehead Historic Commission President, FRAFFIE CHAPMAN. Fraffie’s a no-nonsense gal with white, poofy ha

dialogues.speaker: FRAFFIE
dialogues.text: George Washington visited Marblehead not once, but twice and, see that house over there? Well... She’s seen him. Charlie tries to hide behind a mini-van.  38.

dialogues.speaker: FRAFFIE
dialogues.text: I see you, St. Cloud... Charlie starts walking fast...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m in a hurry, Fraffie...Sorry... Fraffie’s coming after him.

dialogues.speaker: FRAFFIE
dialogues.text: Come back here, St. Cloud... Charlie slips around the corner and ducks into the neares doorway. It’s Maddie’s bar. INT. MADDIE’S - CONT. Charlie just hovers, peering through the window.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: A couple of guys around CHARLIE’S AGE, MIKE and JACK, spo him hovering near the window. They exchange mischievous smiles. Through the window, Charlie sees Fraffie Chapman as she g up the chase and returns to her tour group. He’s about to slip out when Mike and Jack approach, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How’s it going there, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Long time, no see. Charlie’s nervous. He dislikes running into people he kno

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) You see this man here? Best damned shortstop Marblehead High ever had. (to Charlie) How many double plays we turn, Charlie? A couple of hundred? Charlie smiles but he just wants to go. Mike grabs his ar

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Have a beer with us.  39.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Thanks but I can’t. I-

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You owe me, Charlie. Didn’t I fix you up with Betsy Lane, the hottest cheerleader in school?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I fixed you up with Betsy Lane...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (laughs) You did? Hell, then I guess it’s me who owes you. What are you having? Having a beer with some friends is something Charlie hasn done in quite a long time...He checks his watch, decides okay on time. He says to the bartender:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sam Adams. Mike and Jack pat his back and he sits at the bar. INT. MADDIE’S - LATER Charlie’s on his third beer with Mike and Jack, and everybody’s feeling pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: ...-Lots of people been married three times...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (laughs) Not to the same woman. Charlie smiles, then checks his watch. He panics.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What’s-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I have to go... Charlie gets up but Mike bars his way.  40.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not so fast, Charlie... (winks at Jack) We think you need a little break from the cemetery...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What are you-

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We’re gonna sail out to the point. What do you say, Charlie? Want to- Now Charlie’s really panicking. The thought of missing Sa overwhelming...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can’t. I- Charlie tries to move past him, but Mike bars his way.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Back in the old days...when a sailor didn’t want to shove off, he’‘d get shanghied. Charlie tries to get around him, Mike holds on to him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: They’d conk ‘em over the head....

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Or they’d slip him a micky and-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (struggling) Let go of me...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Next thing he knew he was waking up on a boat somewhere in the middle of the North Atlantic. And Charlie completely loses it. He breaks free of Mike a throws a punch that hits Jack square in the jaw. Jack goe down. Charlie grabs up the nearest beer bottle, smashes i the table, waves it around and shouts:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Get out of my way... The guys, the patrons, the bartender...they just stare at Charlie...  4l.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We were just messing with you, Charlie.... Charlie’s still in panic mode. He tosses the bottle down, heads for the door. Standing there are Tess and Tink, who come in just in time to witness this. They’re just lookin Charlie like he’s a madman...Charlie, not even realizing Tess Carroll, charges right past her, out of the door.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Who's that. .?

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (disgusted) The local color... Tess watches Charlie running off through the window, he’s familiar somehow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
