dialogues.text: Sam—

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You’re gonna stick your tongue all the way down her throat then jump her bod and do the nasty-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (irritated) Knock it off.. Sam just looks at him, stung.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I was only goofing around...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I know that, Sam, but sometimes... Sam looks right at him.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: What, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Nothing... Sam’s sulking, Charlie goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Come on, Sam... Sam lashes out.  63.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You’re sick and tired of hanging out with a kid, aren’t you, Charlie? That’s why you’re going out with her... Sam’s young and frightened, his insecurities are getting best of him and it breaks Charlie’s heart.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Nobody’s ever gonna take your place, Sam. (smiles ) Especially not some...girl... (then) You wanna go for a swim? Sam lights up with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Sam emerge from the water. Charlie starts get his stuff together...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You remember me telling you that I made out with Jenny Childers..?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. .?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (sheepish) Well, I was kind of...lying.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles ) Oh...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: So...what’s it like exactly? To kiss a girl? Charlie looks at his kid brother...who will never get to a girl.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Truthfully, Sam...? I can hardly remember myself.  64. INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Charlie and Tess are lingering over what seems to have be very successful meal. The lights are low, R&B pulses from the sound system, and they are both pleasantly tipsy from the bottle of wine th they've emptied. Tess looks over Charlie’s boat sketches laid out on the table.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Wow...you know, you really should be building these. (he smiles) This is still my favorite... It’s the sketch of Querencia modified.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Querencia...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: It’s Spanish for-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The place in the ring where the bull feels safe...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiles ) You know your Hemingway. (Charlie smiles) It’s also the place where we feel the most secure - It’s where we can be ourselves... (then) Where’s yours, Charlie? Where’s your Querencia?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Right here, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: The cemetery?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Marblehead... (she chuckles) What. .?  65.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Come on, Charlie...I love Marblehead too, but...it’s like the song says... (smiles, shakes her head) You can’t buy a thrill... Charlie’s looking right at her, into those sea-green eyes And Tess is feeling it too...thinking maybe you can buy a thrill, after all...Then...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Umm...we need more wine... Charlie gets up and heads off into the kitchen. Tess watches him go. She smiles, still not sure what to m of him. Then she gets up, stretches out...and gravitates toward the big, messy bookcase. It’s filled with an eclec assortment- everything from World Lit to Archeology to bo on all matters related to the afterlife. But it’s a certa sailing book that gets her attention, it’s lying beneath cardboard box on the top shelf. She reaches for it, tryin slide it out from beneath the box. But the box falls and contents spill onto the floor -

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHS, DOZENS OF THEM
dialogues.text: We see splashes of images, young Charlie, Sam and their mother... INT. CHARLIE’S KITCHEN - NIGHT Charlie’s trying to get a bottle of wine open with the corkscrew. But his hand is trembling with nerves. He chastises himself...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Get a grip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks in with the wine bottle. Tess doesn’t see h she’s seated on the floor, looking at a photo of a young Charlie with his mother. Charlie doesn’t like being confronted with these long ago images...But he covers it he says:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That’s my mom. Tess looks up, startled.  66.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Charlie, I’m sorry, I was reaching for a book and-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s okay... He bends down and starts putting the pictures back.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: When my mom moved up to Portland, we divi’d up the family photos...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I guess, you’re not the album type... (holding a photo) You and...Sam, right? CLOSE ON PHOTO - YOUNG CHARLIE AND SAM, arms around each other, aboard their sailboat, mugging for the camera. Cha has to hide his pain.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We were out at the point... And Charlie quickly starts tossing the photos back into t box. But Tess is fascinated by them. Picture after pictur Sam and Charlie sailing...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Charlie? Was Sam the reason?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The reason for what?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: The reason you stopped sailing. Charlie just looks at her. She sure can press his buttons

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s all right... (then, after a beat...) Sam and me...we were gonna sail around the world, too.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (delighted) You were?  And Charlie just starts talking, as if in a dream...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Marquesas, Tuamoto, Zanzibar, Fiji...all of those faraway places that hang off the edge of the map by their fingernails...we were gonna see ‘em all... (then) After the accident...I tried taking the boat out a few times but... (he shakes his head) 67. Charlie’s never said these things to anybody. Tess takes hand.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: When I lost my dad...I thought I’d never get over it. (gently) But we’ve gotta keep going, Charlie... Tess looks deep into Charlie’s eyes...

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “Trust your heart if the seas catch fire..” (then) You’ve got to take a chance... Then, almost imperceptibly, Charlie leans toward her. barely whispers:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: What are you..?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Taking a chance... Then, in the grip of emotions he’s never before felt, pulls her into his arms...and kisses her with all the .-Tess Charlie passion, longing and tenderness...that his lonely heart contains. Then it’s over. Both of them overwhelmed and unprepared f the powerful emotions coursing through them.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Timing is everything, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What do you-  68.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’m leaving in a week, remember? Charlie nods grimly. Then...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I oughtta go...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Can I walk you? Let me-

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (she touches his cheek) Good night, Charlie St. Cloud... And Tess walks out the door. Charlie’s cottage has never seemed so empty, and his heart is aching. Then... A knock at the door. Charlie opens it. Tess lands in his arms. They’re kissing passionately...Bumping into furnitu tearing off clothes as they make their way into the bedro INT. CHARLIE’S BEDROOM - DAWN Charlie’s just stirring. He sits up sleepily and looks around. He’s alone. He’s surprised, dismayed...And then h sees, taped to his mirror-

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE HAND DRAWN SAIL BOAT
dialogues.text: Charlie takes it down. He turns it over to find three wor written: COME FIND ME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s heading through a clearing. He stops in tracks, stunned as he sees- HIS OLD SAILBOAT - ON THE WATER’S EDGE - SAIL RAISED AND

dialogues.speaker: GLEAMING
dialogues.text: Tess at the Tiller. She calls out to him:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiling) I knew you’d find me... Charlie starts walking slowly toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (re: the boat) It seemed so forlorn...I just had to save it...  69. Charlie stops at the water’s edge, still somewhat stunned Finally, Tess laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Charlie...what are you waiting for? And she holds out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! CLOSE ON: The bow of the little sailboat carving across the bay. PULL BACK: Charlie is at the tiller, Tess works the mains and jib ropes. They are sailing the boat hard, into a fre north-east wind. For Charlie...the sensation of being out on the water again...is one of just pure, unadulterated...joy, and he’ having the time of his life.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE/TESS
dialogues.text: Yeeeha! Then...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The wind’s picking up. Standby to let out the main!

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Aye, aye, Cap... Charlie’s having the time of his life. He smiles at Tess, knowing he’s got her to thank for this. She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Tess have just pulled the boat onto shore. Charlie’s so exhilarated, he can’t calm down.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Let’s go out again tomorrow. We can-

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Sure, and next time I’1l give you a few pointers on how to-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (laughs) Oh, you will..?  70. Tess laughs. Charlie just looks at her. Then he kisses he

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Tess just smiles. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’ve got a million things to do before next week...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sure... She kisses him. Then:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: We can meet here for lunch. Right after Aunt Abby.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: , (laughs ) Who? And off she goes. Charlie watches her. He’s got the bigge smile on his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s still wearing that smile as he hoses off a gravestone. Joe’s with him, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Dumbass grin can only mean one thing...Sonavabitch...Who is she? Give it up, Charlie, or I’‘ll- And Charlie laughingly turns the hose on him. Joe laughs he runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess’s AUNT ABBY, an ancient gal in her eighties, sits staring out of the window. Tess walks in. She smiles sadly. Then she comes over and gives her aunt a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Hey, Aunt Abby...You look pretty today. Aunt Abby just stares off, Tess’s presence not registerin  71.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Whatcha looking at? That sparrow? There’s a sparrow on a limb right outside the window. He flies off.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: There he goes... (then she smiles) Aunt Abby...? Aunt Abby, I met somebody. His name is Charlie and he’s a sailor like me...You’d like him, Aunt Abby, he’s very sweet...but he’s very sad... (whispers) Don’t tell mom, but I kinda let him get to first base last night. Actually, he got a little bit further than-

dialogues.speaker: AUNT ABBY
dialogues.text: Tess..? Tess is startled. She comes around to face her aunt.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Aunt Abby...

dialogues.speaker: AUNT ABBY
dialogues.text: Are you all right, dear?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (laughs) I’m fine. I’m great...I’m...

dialogues.speaker: AUNT ABBY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, dear. Everything’s going to be all right, and I’1l see you very soon. And then Aunt Abby’s eyes close, her head tilts and she’s snoring softly. Tess smiles, kisses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Tess sit on a blanket with a now empty picnic basket beside them. You can tell that they’ve been here f hours.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: It’s the first time she’s spoken to me in months. I think it’s a sign of something...Something good.  72.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles ) It’s a sign that you’re gonna win the race. Tess smiles tentatively:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Or a sign that you’re gonna say, yes, to what I’m gonna ask you... Charlie smiles, kisses her neck.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Ask me anything. Whatever it is...whatever you want...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Will you meet me in Cape Town? Charlie’s just looking at her. What..?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: The first leg of the race...that’s where it ends.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess, I...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Will you, Charlie? Please, it would just be so great... She’s waiting for an answer. Charlie’s tormented.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess, I just...I...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I know it’s crazy, Charlie, I know we just met but...

dialogues.speaker: THE SUNSET CANNON BOOMS
dialogues.text: The startled Charlie goes white.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Charlie can barely control his panic.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I have to get back...  73. And they’re hurrying to his truck.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s...the sprinklers. The timer’s all haywire and the whole place is about to get drenched... EXT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - SUNSET They get out of the pickup. Charlie’s already off and running, prevailing on Tess:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This won’t take long... Tess looks after him, curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie breathlessly crashes into the glade.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (shouts ) Sam? Sam, are you here? Sam... And then Charlie just stands there, frozen...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: SAM STANDING THERE
dialogues.text: And Sam’s frightened, quivering, nearly in tears.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You broke the promise, Charlie...You broke the promise... Charlie rushes over to his brother, tries to touch him... his hand passes through.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (anguished) Don’t go, Sam. You gotta try to hang on.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I can. It might be too late...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Why weren’t you here, Charlie? Why weren't you- Then...lighting up relieved...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You’re doing it, Sam. See? You’re coming back...It’s gonna be okay... And, sure enough, Sam’s becoming more visible. Charlie ca grab Sam’s arm now, his hand no longer passes through. Bu Sam’s still angry and distraught.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Where the hell were you?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Sam. I-

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: It's Tess, isn’t it, Charlie? That’s why you’re late. You'd rather be with-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No. No...It’ll never happen again, Sam...I swear to God...You’re my brother and I’m not gonna lose you.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Maybe you better tell her... Charlie turns around. There’s Tess.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to spy on you... Charlie is mortified.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Charlie, it’s okay. I talk to my dad all the time. (nods toward sea) When I was out there, he was with me. As sure as Sam’s here now. Now Charlie glances toward Sam, who is obviously feeling threatened...  75.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I made him a promise that...I’d always take care of him.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I get it, Charlie, I really do... Charlie just looks at her, he really does want her to understand...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We didn’t have a dad like yours. It was my job to protect him...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiles ) I’m sure you were a great big brother. He was lucky to have you. Tess comes over to Charlie and takes his hand. She raises to her lips and gently kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (gently) Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Your place. We were talking about Cape Town, remember? The frightened Sam cries out.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Charlie, no!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Cape Town...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Don’t go, Charlie! Please!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Remember our promise.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I know we just met...But, Charlie...I want to be with you...  76. Charlie tears his eyes away from Tess. He looks at his frightened, little brother...Then to Tess:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can’t just take off whenever I feel like it...I have a job...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’m sure your job will still be here...and besides...aren’t you the boss?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (sheepish) I’ve got a lot going on. It’s hard to explain... Tess sighs sadly. And starts walking away.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: It’s okay...you don’t have to...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess, wait...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: You’re right...We barely even know each other... And she starts walking off. Sam smiles. Charlie goes afte her, stops her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess, please-

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’ve got a race to get ready for...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s not that I don’t want to. I'd go if I could...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Then what is it? What’s keeping you here? Charlie looks at Tess, he’s going to tell her...Then he glances at Sam, frightened, waiting...nearly quaking with fear.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Good luck with your race, Tess. Good luck with everything...  77. Tess’s heart is broken. Then she turns and walks away. Sa comes up beside his brother.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I love you, bro... Charlie just looks at Sam. He’s made his choice and he’1l live with it. He throws his arm around Sam.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I love you too... EXT. TESS’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - NIGHT A single light burns high up in the widow’s walk of an eighteenth century house overlooking the harbor. Tess walks in, looks around, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Mom? But the house is empty. Tess sighs and plops down in the window seat of the widow’s walk, gazes mournfully out ove the dark water. Bobbo, trots in. He whines pitifully. Tess sighs.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Yep Bobo, you got it in one... INT. CHARLIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT CLOSE ON: Charlie. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can’t come to Cape Town, because every evening I play ball with my dead brother in the cemetery - (intensely cheerful) Of course I’m not crazy! PULL BACK: Charlie, sitting drinking alone, is talking to thin air. Suddenly engulfed by sadness, his smile fades. murmurs. CHARLIE (cont'd) Really... I’m not... Charlie gulps scotch from the glass in his hand.  78. EXT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - DAWN Charlie, looking like hell and feeling even worse, is jus now discovering that he’s out of coffee. He shakes out th few remaining grounds from the bag...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Shit... Then...a knock at the door. Tess? Charlie rushes to open Joe's standing there with a shit eating grin.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: It’s Mary Dempsey, you’re doing, ain’t it?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don’t even know Mary... Charlie closes the door in Joe’s face and turns away. Joe opens the door and comes inside.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (calls out) Yo! Mar-eee...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: There’s nobody here... Then he looks at Charlie, realizes for the first time how disheveled he is.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: You sure do look like a night with Mary Dempsey...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I just...need some coffee...

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (notices empty bag ) Damn...no woman and no coffee...Now, that’s messed up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. TESS’S MOM’S HOUSE - DAY Tess is walking toward Bobo with a leash.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Come on, boy, let’s go fora walk...  79. Bobo gets up and rushes past Tess, right out through the doggie door.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rustic little dive on the water. The place filled up wi early morning regulars. Charlie’s thoughts are miles away he sits with Joe and sips his coffee. Joe talks to waitre

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: (to waitress) What’s up, Loretta? How’s the kids?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (sour) I got one with his arm busted and two down with chickenpox. Thank you for asking... Charlie glances out the window and notices Tink hurrying along the dock. He meets a couple of other watermen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess runs down the beach, chasing Bobo. Up ahead, she see FISHERMAN she knows. She calls out:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Hey, Dubby, grab him, will you? Dubby makes no attempt to stop the dog and as Tess runs b she laughs:

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Thanks for nothing, Dubby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s still watching as Tink and the group enter the and go to a big wall-sized nautical chart of the area. A couple of the locals drift over and join the group.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: So what‘ll it be, guys? Charlie gets up and approaches Tink’s group. As he nears huddle he hears snatches of conversation: “Coast Guard chopper could...” “been over forty-eight hours since...” “where was your last contact from?...”  80. Through the window we see a distressed Grace Carroll walk with HODDY SNOW, the officious-looking harbor master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess chases Bobo, who’s now heading toward town. She’s getting seriously irritated.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Bobo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie steps into the group.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: WATER MAN
dialogues.text: There’s a boat missing, Charlie. CLOSE ON: Charlie. Almost instinctively he asks:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Which boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess calls to a young woman walking along the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Hey Julie, Bobo’s gone crazy...! JULIE looks through Tess as if she doesn’t exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Water Man’s battling his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: WATER MAN
dialogues.text: The Querencia...Tess Carroll’s boat. Charlie is in shock. Some of the locals overhear and leav their tables to join the throng at the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, irritated, speaks directly into Julie’s face.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Julie...  81. No response. Tess turns to a mirrored storefront window, seeking her reflection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is reeling. This just can’t be... The men in the group make way for Grace Carroll, who’s ju walked in. Her face is tear-streaked as she makes her way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (to Tink) The Coast Guard doesn’t have a man to spare. It seems there are some fishing boats in trouble... Finally, Charlie just has to speak up.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This is a mistake. All eyes are on him. Tink looks at him disdainfully:

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: How the hell would you know, St. Cloud?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess isn’t missing. I was with her yesterday. Everybody’s befuddled. What’s going on here..?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You were with my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am, I was. We had dinner together and a picnic and-

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (scowling) She hasn’t been seen or heard from in over forty-eight hours. She’s out there somewhere. She never came back... PUSH IN: On Charlie desperately holding back fear. Everybody, including Joe, is shaking their heads, thinking...crazy Charlie again.  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see what Tess sees in the mirror -- life continuin around her on the street, but no reflection back of herse Gripped with panic, Tess slowly buckles to the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie still reeling as Tink addresses the group.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Anybody with a boat, please... We can use all the help we can get.

dialogues.speaker: WATERMAN 1
dialogues.text: (to Charlie) What about you? Why don’t you make yourself useful and-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (dazed) You're too late... Everybody’s aghast. Charlie turns and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s rushing down the street, looking in all directi No sign of Tess. Then he has a thought. He takes off towa the water. Soon...up ahead...he sees her.

dialogues.speaker: TESS ON THE DOCK
dialogues.text: Her back to Charlie, gazing out at the water.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess! Tess turns around. There’s Charlie rushing toward her. An less than a moment, she’s in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Charlie, thank God...I thought I was going crazy or...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (anguished) Tess—  83.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Nobody can see me, Charlie. Nobody but you... Tess can tell by Charlie’s face that something is horribl wrong.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Tell me what’s happening...Tell me I’m real... Charlie knows he has to be strong for her. It isn’t easy. A procession of boats motor past the dock on their way ou the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (gently) They’re going out to search for you.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Search for me..? But...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: When you went out on your test run...you ran into that storm front...Do you remember what happened? And Tess tries her best to concentrate...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I lied to Tink about my position... I remember asking my dad for help and then...the next thing I knew...I was there at his grave... Charlie’s having a hard time holding it together.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (hardest words he’s ever spoken) When you went out on the Querencia...you didn’t come back. Tess is thunderstuck. She starts shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: What..? No...that’s...  84.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess...I can see you...because I can see Sam. Then finally, an anguished cry...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I am not dead!...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I have a whole life to live. I want to sail. (imploring) I want to love. They look into each other’s eyes...Charlie’s heart is breaking. And then...Tess begins to slowly fade...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I’m so cold...why am I so..? Tess panics as she realizes what’s happening to her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess, hang on...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Find me, Charlie... Charlie tries to hold onto Tess, but his hands go right through her. Their faces are inches apart. Tess’s voice i drifting far away.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess, please-

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Come find me... And then...she’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No... Tink passes with his boat. He’s seen Charlie talking to himself. He turns away with disgust.  85. Charlie’s left alone on the dock, the mournful foghorn blows... INT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - DAY Charlie’s wall...with it’s meticulous round trip charts a sunset tables and dozens of sailboat sketches. PULL BACK TO: Charlie standing there, staring at them.. Then, in a rage he rips the charts from the wall, tearing them into pieces and flinging them across the room. Next his sailboat sketches - one after another, he rips them f the wall. But there’s one sailboat sketch that stops him

dialogues.speaker: THE QUERENCIA
dialogues.text: It’s the sketch of Charlie’s re-imagined version of Tess’ boat. Charlie can’t bring himself to pull this one from t wall but the sight of it absolutely breaks his heart. * Then he calms down, composes himself...He knows what he h to do... INT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - LATE AFTERNOON Charlie’s at his desk, writing a letter. CLOSE ON LETTER - All we see are the words: “DEAR MOM, I’M SORRY FOR EVERYTHING...” And- “NOW I’LL BE WITH SAM...” And we are led to the inescapable conclusion that Charlie Cloud is planning to take his life...Then...there’s a kno on the door. Charlie ignores it, or tries to. Then-

dialogues.speaker: JOE'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open up, Charlie, I know you’re in there. You gotta knock off the crazy shit, Charlie! * Charlie grits his teeth...

dialogues.speaker: ON JOE
dialogues.text: Outside pounding on the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: We got a six P.M. service, and * we're short on crew.  86.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He grimaces. He knows Joe’s not leaving. He barks:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’ll be right there... He stashes his suicide letter in the desk drawer, closes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A funeral’s in progress. A large gathering of friends, fa and firefighters and a row of uniformed men with bagpipes The Chief of the Fire Department is delivering a eulogy. Charlie’s standing nearby, pretty out of it...

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We thank you Lord for the life of a great man. We are grateful for his devotion to a fireman’s duty, for his dedication to the preservation of life, etc... In the distance, the sunset cannon booms. Charlie hears i He starts toward the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie plops down miserably on a log, waiting for Sam. T a voice...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Charlie. He turns around. It’s Florio Ferrente in his dress unifor

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: Charlie St. Cloud.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (stands up) Yeah. .?

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: (warm smile) It’s been a long time, Charlie...Thirteen years...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I...  87.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: June 9th, ‘95. Bridge Street and Flint. Charlie is rocked. He remembers now.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I didn’t recognize you... Florio approaches Charlie and somewhat awkwardly embraces in a gentle hug.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: It’s so good to see you again...I’m Florio, by the way. Florio Ferrente. Then Charlie nods in the direction of the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So how did you..?

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: Apartment fire over in Revere...Little girl saved her kitty, I saved the little girl...but no one saved me...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: It’s the job. I wouldn’t have it any other way. (Charlie nods) I’ve thought about you over the years...I’ve thought about you a lot...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You have?

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: Twenty seven years on the job, Charlie, and you...you were my only miracle. Charlie is both profoundly moved and ashamed of himself. a

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: I always figured that there must have been some purpose to it...Am I right, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don't...

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: A miracle without one is just...God showing off... Florio’s looking right at him, Charlie can barely meet hi eyes. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Hello. Sam has walked into the glade.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This is my brother-

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: (he knows ) Sam.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Do you know me?

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: (in Italian) “Muor giovane coluiche al cielo e caro.” (Sam’s confused) “Whom the Gods love die young.” Florio walks toward him. Looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: I was the one who brought your brother back. After the accident.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: I want you to know that it broke my heart, letting you go...but I could only save one of you, and Charlie had the best chance. Sam smiles. ee

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You did your best...you saved Charlie. Florio smiles at Charlie:

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: My only miracle... Charlie is profoundly moved. And also ashamed of himself. Then...in the distance - bagpipe music.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: You hear that? That’s my favorite part of the service... And Florio starts to head out of the glade back toward hi funeral service.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: You have yourself a great life, Charlie. Bye, Sam... And Florio musses Sam’s hair as he heads off. Charlie and Sam watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You ever think, Sam...that maybe we made a mistake?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It seemed like such a good idea. A great idea...only now, I’m not so sure... And now Sam knows...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (rocked) Charlie...how can you-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: There’s more for us, Sam, there’s got to be. Sam just looks at Charlie...Then, bitterly-  90.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I know what’s going on, here, Charlie....don’t think I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s not what you think...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You’re a liar, Charlie. You’re-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sam, Tess is...dead.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (stunned) What. .?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (glances toward ocean) She went out in the storm...She’s lost at sea...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: But...she was here the other day...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That was her spirit... Sam takes it in...then...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Charlie...Charlie...I’m sorry... And Sam gives Charlie a hug. Charlie looks at his little brother, realizes how great he is, how much he loves him. smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’ll see you tomorrow, okay? Sam smiles with reassurance.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Okay... And Charlie walks out of the glade. INT. CHARLIE’S COTTAGE - NIGHT Charlie walks in and surveys the mess he’s made. The only thing still on the wall is his sketch of the Querencia. Then he walks to the desk, opens the drawer - he’s lookin  gl.

dialogues.speaker: HIS SUICIDE NOTE
dialogues.text: He picks it up and tears it into pieces which he tosses i the trash. Then as he’s about to close the drawer...he se something in there, it was lying beneath the note...Was i there before...? He picks it up. TESS’S HAND DRAWN SAILBOAT PICTURE It breaks Charlie’s heart to see it. Then he turns it ove There are those three words again-

dialogues.speaker: COME FIND ME
dialogues.text: Charlie sighs deeply. He places the note back in the draw a memento he will forever cherish. He closes the drawer a starts picking up the tattered remains of the charts and sketches he’d torn off the wall. But he’s stopped cold when lying on the floor, he sees-

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER HAND DRAWN SAILBOAT SKETCH
dialogues.text: It’s identical to the other. He turns it over. Those word again... COME FIND ME... Charlie is baffled...where did this second sketch come fr And as he studies it, he hears...a sound...a ripping soun He wheels around to see-

dialogues.speaker: THE QUERENCIA SKETCH ON THE WALL
dialogues.text: The tape that’s holding it is giving way...the sketch is slowly starting to peel away... And as it does, one by one it reveals the words, scrawled there on the wall... COME FIND ME... The sketch falls onto the floor. Charlie is rocked, unable to move...Come find me, come fi me...and then-

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiling) I knew you’d find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: te OK

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The last time Charlie saw her...fading away...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Come find me, Charlie. Find me....

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (screaming) Tess...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I am not dead!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weary-looking Tink’s just tied up his boat. He walks the dock with the frantic Charlie at his heels.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: This morning you said we were wasting our time.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I was wrong. She’s out there somewhere but she’s running out of time...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Even with a survival suit, the Coast Guard’s putting her chances at slim to none.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tink-

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: We’re going back out in the morning. Charlie grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If you won’t go, then lend me your boat.  93. Tink snorts, “Yeah, right,” pulls away, and keeps on walk leaving Charlie behind. Charlie doesn’t miss a beat. He t around and makes a dash for Tink’s boat. He quickly untie and leaps aboard. ON TINK’S BOAT - CONT Charlie rushes into the wheel house and starts the engine

dialogues.speaker: ON TINK
dialogues.text: Hearing his boat engine start up. He wheels around, sees what’s happening and charges toward his boat like an angr bull.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Sonavabitch!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Charlie’s at the wheel, moving her out of the slip.

dialogues.speaker: TINK LEAPS OFF THE DOCK
dialogues.text: And just barely makes it onto the boat. He scrambles to h feet and attacks Charlie, shoving him roughly up against wall. Charlie tries to break free, but Tink’s too big and strong. Tink then lifts Charlie up and hurls him across t wheel house...everything goes flying, including the radio which gets smashed on the floor. Tink’s coming for him again. Charlie scrambles up. Tink’s coming toward him with murder in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Go on, throw me overboard. I'll get another boat. And another one if I have to.. Tink stops, he bellows half in anguish, half in anger.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You don’t even know her!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I know she sailed into the storm, not around it. I know you’ve been searching in the wrong goddamn place...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: How do you know..?  94.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (thinking fast) A week before the race...wouldn’t she want to test her boat in heavy weather? Maybe you're the one who doesn’t know her.. Despite himself, Tink sees the logic of this...Still, he glowers at Charlie as he says:

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: The first time I catch you talking to somebody that I cannot see...you’re going in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie nods. EXT. TINK’S BOAT - NIGHT Tink’s boat threads slowly through a chain of small islan that arc out of the sea like humpbacks. The boat’s powerful searchlight sweeps an eerily calm, in black ocean. Tink’s at the wheel as Charlie, manning the searchlight, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess! Tess! His voice bounces forlornly back from the rocks. EXT./INT. TINK’S BOAT - DAWN Charlie and Tink have been up all night and it shows. In cabin, Charlie’s poring over the nautical maps while Tink tries to get the broken radio to work.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Come in, Coast Guard. Coast Guard can you hear me? Come in Coast Guard... Tink releases the talk button and gets only static. He finally gives up.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How are we on gas?  95.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Getting low. We can refuel and pick up some sandwiches at Portsmouth. Tink yawns mightily.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You wanna grab some sleep?

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: No...I’m good... EXT. OCEAN/TINK’S BOAT - DAY Tink is sound asleep. Charlie is at the tiller, scanning horizon. He can’t see shit, it’s foggy as hell...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Where are you, Tess? Where are you..?

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Charlie, weary, running on fumes, still at the wheel. Now Charlie’s got his eye on-

dialogues.speaker: THE HAZY YELLOW SUN
dialogues.text: Tink walks over, sees Charlie watching the sun. He hands a beer.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: When that sun goes down it’s gonna be like sailing through a tunnel. Charlie’s not thinking about the darkness, he’s thinking about Sam as he says:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We’'ll find her. And we’1l be back before the sun goes down... Charlie wants to believe this with all his heart.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Tink steers toward a small island. Charlie calls out:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess! Tess!  96. No reply. Charlie dares to glance skyward-

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN IS JUST STARTING TO SINK
dialogues.text: Charlie’s getting desperate.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Head for Shark’s Bay... Tink shakes his head but he turns the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tink’s trying the radio again. Charlie’s going over the navigational maps and charts, crossing out the areas that have already been searched.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Shark’s Bay, Pilot Rock, Boon Island, Cape Porpoise...Newburyport... (fervent) -..-That just leaves...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (frustrated) It leaves about one hundred square miles of- Charlie gets up and heads for the deck.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I know where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s at the wheel with Tink. The water’s getting rougher, the boat’s unsteady, the cold sea sweeps the dec and both men have to shout above the din of the waves.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Mingo Rock! That’s gotta be twenty miles out...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: She hit some rough weather out by the shoals. Mingo Rock is the last place-

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: How do you know she-  97.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Because that’s what she said.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (angry laugh) That’s what she said? And when exactly did she- Charlie realizes he slipped up.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You’re gonna have to trust me on-

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (ordering) Turn her around...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tink...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: We can still get back before dark... Charlie instinctively looks up at the sun. It’s starting to sink. He could still make it back for Sam. His hands are unsteady on the wheel... He turns back to Tink.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: We’re not going in. Tink just snorts and makes a move toward the wheel. Charl blocks him, gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How are you gonna feel when they find her, Tink? When they find her dead at Mingo Rock? This stops Tink. He just glares at Charlie...Then...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You’d better be right, St. Cloud... Or its gonna be you they find at Mingo Rock... Tink storms away. Charlie looks back at the sun...  98.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN IS SETTING
dialogues.text: Charlie’s still at the wheel, staring off at the sun. He murmurs softly...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sitting on a log, waiting. He tosses his ball in the and catches it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Charlie’s on the deck. He stares out at the big, orange s sinking into the sea. After thirteen years, and thousands sunsets, Charlie registers the enormity of his decision. then the tears start to come...

dialogues.speaker: THE GLADE
dialogues.text: ..-As the last of the sun’s light bathes it in amber... The pond, empty and still. The grassy area...vacant. And the log Sam was sitting on...He sits there no longer. Then as the CAMERA MOVES THROUGH THE GLADE...We find-

dialogues.speaker: SAM ON THE BLUFF
dialogues.text: Looking out to sea...and just beginning to fade away...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE BOAT
dialogues.text: Charlie, a tear streaming down his cheek as he watches th last of the sunset...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Sam... Then...

dialogues.speaker: TINK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We should be coming up on it... Charlie turns to Tink...  99.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah... CLOSE ON: The bow of Tink’s boat ploughing through the wa CUT TO: The bridge. Charlie and Tink look out in expectat as the boat rounds an island. CLOSE ON: Charlie. He silently prays as... CHARLIE’S POV: The island clears from view and.... He sig QUERENCIA’S CAPSIZED HULL. He does not know whether to feel joy or despair. Querenci wallows on the gentle swell like an upturned, bloated carcass. Wedged between two small islands, the boat’s kee partially snapped off. Tink is amazed, horrified and ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: God damn...How did you..? Snapping into action, Charlie barks at Tink.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Take the wheel... Tink grabs the wheel as Charlie starts pulling off his sh

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: What the hell-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Get as close as you can!

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: That water’s freezing. You'll kill yourself... Charlie runs to the bow of the boat. He pauses, staring a Querencia’s stricken hull. He murmurs a silent prayer. And then... WIDE: Charlie dives... UNDERWATER SHOT: An explosion of phosphorescence as Charl body shatters the silent, shimmering, underwater world.  100. He arrows down toward the inverted entrance of Querencia’ cabin. Charlie reaches the storm board which seal the cabin’s entrance. He tries to budge the board. It will not move. CLOSE ON: He struggles desperately with the board, WE HEA the sound of his blood drumming in his ears. He is runnin out of air. Turning on his back, Charlie uses his feet to kick the st board with all his might. CLOSE ON: It budges. With redoubled fury, Charlie kicks. The board slides far enough for Charlie to wriggle into the opening. FOLLOW Charlie into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gasping, Charlie surfaces into the air pocket of the uptu cabin. The water is chest deep. A slice of sunlight penetrates from where the keel has co away from the hull; otherwise the cabin is dark as a tomb The eerily amplified sound of the boat’s hull grinding against rocks, fills our ears. Charlie calls.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess? He takes the pencil light from his pocket and tears it fr its plastic wrapping. Snapping the light on, Charlie casts its beam around the cabin. Everything is literally, turned upside down. Packets of food, maps, clothing, and a mess of other junk floats in the water. CLOSE ON: Charlie. He cannot see Tess. With rising urgenc he scans the beam into every nook and cranny of the cabin CHARLIE (cont'd) Tess? Tess!  101. And then he sees her; unconscious, and almost hidden, Tes wedged into the corner of the far bulkhead. With a cry of relief, Charlie rushes through the water to the woman he loves. CHARLIE (cont'd) Tess! With four steps, Charlie is there. He reaches to take Tes his arms, but stops, horrified. CHARLIE’S POV: It is not Tess. The dark shape was a sail a trick of the shadows. CUT TO: Charlie. He is starting to panic. UNDERWATER SHOT: Charlie plunges beneath the water that f the cabin. Fearing the worst now, he is looking for a cor Nothing. Charlie resurfaces for air, and dives back under. CHARLIE’S UNDERWATER POV: The cabin skylight has been punctured by the ship’s boom, which, still attached to th broken mast, protrudes in from the sea at an unlikely ang The hole seems to have been enlarged to a size big enough a person to fit through. Charlie surfaces. He is still for a moment, trying to understand what it means. And with a huge lung-full of air, plunges back under he water. Dawn, slanting down through the shifting sea, makes the broken skylight seem like the entrance to a bright, white light-filled tunnel. Charlie swims out of the cabin window, and into the light Charlie is now back under the open sea, but on the island side of Querencia's hull. The broken mast is jammed into rocks at the base of the island. Charlie swims past a mess of twisted rigging, searching f sign of Tess. He looks up toward the sunlight. He can see the outline o the island flickering above him.  102. He kicks hard for the surface, but moves only a few inche He tries to move again, but cannot. He glances around, tr to find what is holding him. CLOSE ON: Charlie’s pullover is snagged on some broken rigging. Charlie twists, trying to unhook himself. He cannot. CLOSE ON: Charlie. He has been submerged a long time now. breath is starting to run out. More and more desperately, Charlie twists, and struggles. He tries to take the pullover off, but it tangles around Bubbles escape from his mouth, he cannot hold on any long He screws his eyes tight with the effort of holding the s air inside his bursting lungs. And then... To his great surprise, Charlie is suddenly pulled free by unseen hands. He rips out of the jumper and shoots to the surface. BANG! Breaking the surface, Charlie gratefully gulps air. looks around expectantly for his savior:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tink..? Tink are you..? But Charlie’s alone. Charlie doesn’t understand...B ut then he thinks he does...and he smiles gratefully. On one side, the upturned hull of Querencia blocks Charli view of Tink’s boat. On the other side, is the island. Charlie, barely conscious, struggles to his feet. His eye hardly able to focus, search the rough black rock. And th he sees it...a flash of orange. There! Clad in her orange survival suit, Tess lies very s amongst the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (weakly, hardly a whisper) Tess..?  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a lot of Marblehead residents gathered out here tonight to keep vigil. We see Tink, Grace, Fraffie Chapma Marge and many others... And there’s a TV crew on hand, doing a story on Tess and missing boat. The same reporter, who just interviewed Tes speaks into the camera. He seems pretty emotional.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (into camera) You can see from the number of people out here this morning, waiting, hoping for some word...just how much Tess Carroll means to her hometown of Marblehead...But it’s been over forty-eight hours now...a long time to be out there in the freezing waters of the North Atlantic, and hopes of finding Tess Carroll alive are fading...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE AND A FRIEND
dialogues.text: Grace is listening to the reporter as he puts his stock concerned face on for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I should never have let her go...

dialogues.speaker: FRIEND
dialogues.text: (smiling) Like you could have stopped her..? (Grace smiles sadly) Now...in the b.g. on the water, unnoticed by the crowd, w can see a boat docking. We can barely make it out. Is it Tink’s? The reporter approaches Grace, mike in hand.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Mrs. Carroll, I know it’s a terrible time for you but-

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: This isn’t a wake, young man. My daughter is alive. Maybe you’1ll do another story on her after she sails around the world.  104. Grace turns and walks away from the reporter, leaving him looking a little foolish. Then...from behind the crowd...we just about make out a f of orange, heading slowly toward the crowd... Marge is the first to see it, she can only gasp and say:

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! Now they all see what Marge has seen-

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE CARRYING TESS IN HIS ARMS
dialogues.text: Tess, in her orange survival suit, lies limp in his arms. Charlie looks near death himself as he walks slowly towar the disbelieving crowd. Within moments, Charlie’s enveloped by the throng.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (weakly) Call the hospital. Tell them...

dialogues.speaker: AN SUV COMES SCREECHING UP
dialogues.text: Tink come flying out, he starts helping Charlie get the motionless Tess inside.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Tink! Is she...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: I don’t know... The frenzied reporter and cameraman rush over. It’s absol chaos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty corridor. Many hours have passed. Charlie’s curl up on a bench, sound asleep. There’s a blanket around him Then...two hands gently stir him awake. He opens his eyes...groggy, unfocused...But when he realizes who it is bolts upright...

dialogues.speaker: TESS STANDS BEFORE HIM
dialogues.text: Alive and well and radiantly beautiful. Charlie is amazed and absolutely overjoyed.  105.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess...you’re okay...?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: You saved me, Charlie... Charlie pours out his heart.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s you who saved me. You brought me back. I’m ready to live again, Tess, and I want to be with you. (he knows now...) Tess, you're my Querencia...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiles ) I love you, Charlie St. Cloud... And Charlie reaches out to take her in his arms... But he can’t. TESS IS TRANSPARENT. His arms pass right through her. AND SHE’S FADING AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess, no...NO! But Tess isn’t frightened. She smiles as she says...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I love you... And then she’s just...gone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s frantically rushing down the corridor, paying n heed to the passing doctors, nurses, patients...He gets t the hall marked- ICU. He’s heading in but he’s stopped by brawny MALE NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess Carroll. I have to-  106.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: She’s no longer here. Charlie’s knees get weak. A voice behind him-

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Charlie! Charlie turns around. It’s Grace Carroll, very emotional.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Carroll..? Where’s..? And Grace starts to cry as she hugs Charlie tight

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh, Charlie... Charlie just stands there...unable to move. Then Grace Carroll releases him. And she smiles...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It was touch and go for awhile there, Charlie...but... (near tears) ...-The doctors are saying...it’s a miracle. (Charlie smiles) She’s asking for you. INT. TESS’S HOSPITAL ROOM - EVENING Charlie walks in...There’s Tess, sitting up in bed, talki with Tink, who sees him first.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Here he is.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess... Tink smiles at Tess as he heads toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You need anything?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiling) Just to get out of here...

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: You’re staying put for awhile...  107. Tink pats Charlie’s back on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: See you around... Grateful to be alone with her, Charlie walks to Tess’s bedside.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiles ) If I’d known you were going to save my life, I wouldn’t have been so mean to you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles ) When were you..?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: The other night by my boat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles ) You weren't that mean...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, I was... (then she smiles) So tell me, Charlie St. Cloud...are you still racing? Charlie just looks at her. What’s going on here..?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Racing..? Tess—

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (smiling) You were the captain of the sailing team weren’t you? Charlie gets a sinking feeling in his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tess—

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I was two years behind you in high school. And now Charlie knows for sure...Tess does not remember anything about the time they spent together...when she wa spirit.  108.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Hey...didn’t you get a scholarship to...Dartmouth, right? Charlie looks into those sea green eyes...probably, he figures, for the last time...Then...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You've got a good memory.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sometimes I can’t even remember what day it is...But I owe you my life, Charlie. That’s one thing I’ll never forget...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You should get some rest...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Do you have to go?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I-

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: (laughs) Wait. Don’t tell me. You have to fix the sprinklers or the whole place will... Charlie just looks at her. And Tess realizes it too...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Where’d that come from..?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: I have no...idea... But Charlie knows. And his heart is racing. He looks into those eyes again...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: “Trust your heart though the seas catch fire. And live by love...

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: “,..though the stars walk backward...”  109. Tess just looks at him, not fully understanding it yet, b feeling the connection, the deep bond between them...She reaches out her hand...and Charlie takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks down the street, in no particular hurry. Bu everywhere he goes, somebody seems to want to smile or wa Charlie waves back. Then-

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: St. Cloud! Stop right there! Charlie turns around, his blood runs cold. It’s Fraffie Chapman heading right for him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Look, Fraffie, I- Fraffie gives him a big kiss. Charlie’s stunned. Then, ju like that...Fraffie’s gone. Charlie smiles and keeps walk INT. CARETAKER’S COTTAGE - LATE AFTERNOON Charlie’s throwing a few things in a duffle bag. Joe watc

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'll get the rest of my stuff later.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Won't be the same around here without you...So what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smiles ) I don’t know... He steps outside, then...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe we can meet up at Maddie’s sometime. Grab a beer. Joe just smiles at the “new” Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Let’s see how it goes. Charlie smiles.  110. EXT. CARETAKER’S COTTAGE - SHORT TIME LATER Charlie walks toward his pickup. But then he realizes tha the sun is starting to set. He looks toward the woods at cemetery’s edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks into the glade. It’s deserted. The last of light fades. He hears the sunset cannon’s blast. He smile sadly and sits down on the log:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I miss you, Sam...I miss you already... And then...a voice:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m right here, bro... BUT CHARLIE DOESN’T HEAR THE VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: A HOLOGRAM
dialogues.text: It takes us a moment to realize...that it’s Sam. And he’s no longer twelve, he’s all grown up - a perfect combination of the boy he’d been and the man he’d always hoped to be.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I wish you could see me, Charlie...finally, as I was meant to be...You’d fall right off that log.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I broke the promise, Sam...I’m sorry... Sam kneels down to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You were right to let go. I know that now. We were holding each other back. (then) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (cont'd) Charlie...I can go anywhere, do anything...It’s beyond anything we ever imagined... Charlie gets up, walks past Sam, looks up to heavens.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You were out there with me, weren't you, Sam? You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (smiles ) Call it a miracle. Charlie starts to cry. It breaks Sam’s heart.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh, Charlie...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Why does it have to hurt so bad?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (sad smile) It hurts because you love me. It hurts because you’re alive.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I just want to see you, Sam...Hang out with you and laugh...I want to play catch...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (smiling) We'll be back together in the blink of an eye. There’1ll be all the time in the world for having catches. Charlie calms down. He seems at peace now.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I love you, Sam. We'll always be brothers.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You promise?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I promise. And with that, Charlie takes his last, long look around t glade. And he starts to walk away.  112. As Sam watches him go, he reaches into his jacket pocket something... Charlie’s nearing the woods but he stops in his tracks as sees...

dialogues.speaker: A BASEBALL
dialogues.text: Rolling into his field of vision from behind. He picks th baseball up. Is he dreaming this...? He turns around. There’s nothing there. Not even Sam’s hologram. Charlie’s face lights up with the biggest smile as he tos the ball in the air and catches it. Then:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Night, Sam... And as he walks out of the glade... WE HEAR FLORIO FERRENTE’S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tess and Charlie had to fall in love all over again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People lining up for the Saturday night show...Tess and Charlie hand in hand in line.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They went to the movies at the Warwick... INT. MADDIE’S BAR - NIGHT Charlie turns away from the bar with two drinks in his ha brings them to a table where Tess waits. Joe is here too.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...They had one too many drinks at Maddie's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Tess rush out of the church where they’re pel with rice. They look deliriously happy and it seems like whole town’s turned out.  113.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They got married at the Old North Church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie carrying the laughing Tess across the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They settled down in a house on Cloutman’s Lane. EXT. MARY ALLEY HOSPITAL — DAY Charlie’s pickup screeches to a halt out front. Charlie practically falls out the door, runs around to help Tess She’s laughing hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The baby was born right here in Mary Alley Hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands there, beaming with pride as Tess lies nur their newborn baby.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They named him Sam... EXT. HOUSE ON CLOUTMAN’S LANE - DAY Charlie is teaching little Sam, age 4 to catch a baseball Tess watches from the porch.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The St. Clouds will live out their whole lives in Marblehead without even thinking about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florio stands among the headstones, we recognize Sam’s, s gleaming white in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO
dialogues.text: Well, that’s the end of my story...the miracle of Charlie St. Cloud. (pleased) And as it turns out, the miracle did have a purpose. (looks around) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLORIO (cont'd) Someday Charlie...well, he’1l come back here to Waterside. (smiles ) But for now...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE, TESS AND YOUNG SAM ON A SAILBOAT
dialogues.text: Heading off for a sail around Marblehead.

dialogues.speaker: FLORIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -.-He’s got some sailing to do.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO FLORIO ON THE BLUFF
dialogues.text: Watching Charlie and Tess and little Sam... Then Florio turns toward the woods. As he begins to walk, slowly becomes more and more transparent...and finally fa away. We're left with a pristine view of Marblehead harbor...an sailboat...Charlie and Tess’s boat with sail full...going with the wind.
